title: Fugitive Assata Shakur Dies in Cuba at 78
snippets: Assata Shakur, a Black liberation activist who was given political asylum in Cuba after her 1979 escape from a U.S. prison, has died. Officials in New Jersey, where Shakur had been arrested, convicted and imprisoned, said she was 78.
The fugitive revolutionary spent decades in exile after escaping from a US jail in 1979.
Assata Shakur had lived in exile in Cuba since 1979, after escaping a prison sentence for killing a police officer.

Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison

On 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to
Convicted of murdering a New Jersey state trooper, she escaped prison and fled the country. She called herself “a 20th-century escaped slave.”
Public Enemy's 1988 song “Rebel Without a Pause" includes the lyrics “supporter of Chesimard,” referring to the legal name of the longtime FBI Most Wanted.
titles: Assata Shakur, a fugitive Black militant sought by the U.S. since 1979, dies in Cuba
Assata Shakur, US Black liberation activist exiled in Cuba, dies at 78
Assata Shakur: Fugitive Black activist dies in exile in Cuba
Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
Assata Shakur, Black Power militant who fled to Cuba, dies at 78
Assata Shakur, fugitive Black militant and godmother to Tupac, dies in Cuba
summary: Assata Shakur, a fugitive and former member of the Black Liberation Army who was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from a US jail in 1979, has died at the age of 78 in Havana, Cuba. Shakur, also known by her legal name Chesimard and mentioned in Public Enemy's 1988 song "Rebel Without a Pause," spent decades in exile after fleeing to Cuba.

title: Sinclair to Air "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" Again, Nexstar Holds Out
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigwFBVV95cUxQcS1vVldJUUsyYmtBTXdWS1FtQllsaWhPMHB1Z0lLc18zMGlvTzVGTVRXQlpGTlBlYmpIX1YyUEpRS01RRFBqbzNSTS1Qb3h2QXVnN2JkcUI3bUxNaTZwdXdHV3V4QTdITV9NUUFoRVJ5YVotQmZQVnR1RlczQzJXdUhRVQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Jimmy Kimmel to return to Nexstar and Sinclair's
Broadcast station owners Sinclair and Nexstar will begin airing "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" after three days of preempting the program since its return.

The two station owners’ preemption of the late-night show left about 25% of TV viewers in the US unable to watch it

Local TV conglomerate Sinclair Broadcast Group and Nexstar Media Group said their ABC-affiliate stations will start airing Jimmy Kimmy Live! again on Friday night, ending thei
The Sinclair suspension of Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show prevented it from airing in Washington, D.C., Seattle and other popular markets.
Sinclair and Nexstar agreed to air "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" on its ABC stations again.

Local-television giants Sinclair Inc. and Nexstar Media Group Inc. said Friday that they were ending their boycott of late-night talk-show host Jimmy Kimmel’s program, returning “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” to the companies’ ABC affiliate stations.
Sorry, Brendan Carr: Sinclair and Nexstar stop preempting Kimmel on ABC affiliates.
titles: Jimmy Kimmel to return to Nexstar and Sinclair's ABC affiliates Friday - Axios
Sinclair, Nexstar will bring 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' back to owned ABC stations on Friday
Sinclair and Nexstar end boycott of Jimmy Kimmel Live! and will air show again
Sinclair’s 38 Stations Will Air ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’ After Boycott After Charlie Kirk Monologue
Sinclair and Nexstar agree to bring back 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' to their ABC stations
Sinclair, Nexstar end boycott of Jimmy Kimmel show
Sinclair gets nothing it asked for, puts Jimmy Kimmel back on anyway
summary: Sinclair Broadcast Group will resume airing "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" on its 38 ABC affiliate stations after a three-day suspension, leaving Nexstar as the only broadcaster still not airing the show. This decision follows Disney's reinstatement of Kimmel earlier in the week. Sinclair's suspension had affected major markets including Washington, D.C., and Seattle.

title: Musk, Thiel, Bannon Named in Event Document; Musk Declined Invitation
snippets: The documents by the estate of convicted paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein were released by Congressional Democrats.

Prince Andrew and Steve Bannon also referenced in six-page batch of documents made public with redactions

Democratic lawmakers on Friday released documents from the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein that may show interactions between the disgraced financier and prominent conservatives, inc
"Reminder: Elon Musk to island Dec. 6 (is this still happening?)" one scheduling note says. Musk previously said he declined island invites.
The schedules show high-profile names penciled in for lunches, flights, and island trips.
titles: Elon Musk and Prince Andrew named in new Epstein files
Elon Musk, Peter Thiel and Steve Bannon named in Epstein files released by Democrats - Axios

title: Trump Calls for Firing of Microsoft Exec Lisa Monaco Over Biden Ties
snippets: Trump demands Microsoft oust president over Biden-era ties
Fox Business anchor Maria Bartiromo brought up Monaco's position at Microsoft during her show. The appointment happened in July.
President Donald Trump on Friday called for the firing of  Microsoft's president of global affairs, Lisa Monaco, on Truth Social.

After successfully manipulating Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan and eventually failing to cancel Jimmy Kimmel, President Donald Trump has named his next target for retribution: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco. He’s calling for her to be fired. On Truth Social, Trump claims that Monaco, who just to
titles: Trump demands Microsoft oust president over Biden-era ties - Axios
Trump calls for the firing of Lisa Monaco, Microsoft president of global affairs
Trump calls for the firing of Microsoft's president of global affairs, Lisa Monaco
Trump’s new target: Microsoft head of global affairs Lisa Monaco
summary: Former President Donald Trump called for the firing of Microsoft's President of Global Affairs, Lisa Monaco, on Truth Social. Trump's demand comes after Monaco's appointment in July, citing her ties to the Biden era. This move follows Trump's previous attempts to influence corporate leadership, including Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan and a failed effort to cancel Jimmy Kimmel.

title: Europe Leads USA 5.5-2.5 After Ryder Cup Day 1 at Bethpage Black
snippets: Europe open up a three-point lead over USA after a dramatic first day of the Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black in New York.

Tommy Fleetwood, Rory McIlroy and Jon Rahm didn't lose a match in the first two sessions Friday, while Scottie Scheffler and Bryson DeChambeau failed to earn a point, allowing the Europeans to take a 5.5-2.5 lead on the U.S. at the Ryder Cup.
Europe leads 3-1 after the early matches on the first day. Can U.S. mount an afternoon comeback?
Europe leads by three points after the opening day of the Ryder Cup but a Rory McIlroy miss Friday evening gave the U.S. a bit of hope going into Day 2.

• Europe lead 5½-2½ after first day at Bethpage Black

  • Visitors win both foursomes and fourballs sessions

Bethpage Black became Bethpage blue. Europe had waited 21 years to lead at the end of a Ryder Cup’s opening day on American soil. In 2004, they romped to v
titles: Europe take three-point lead on opening day of Ryder Cup
Europe quiets U.S., up 3 after Day 1 of Ryder Cup
Ryder Cup 2025 best moments: U.S. trails Europe after Day 1
Europe in command but U.S. with some hope as Day 1 concludes at Ryder Cup
Fleetwood and Rahm stun USA as Europe take three-point Ryder Cup lead on opening day
summary: Europe took a significant three-point lead over the USA, with a score of 5.5-2.5, after the first day of the Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black in New York. Key players for Europe, including Tommy Fleetwood, Rory McIlroy, and Jon Rahm, did not lose a match, contributing to their team's lead. Despite a missed shot by McIlroy in the evening, the European team ended the day ahead, having won both the foursomes and fourballs sessions, marking their first lead on American soil at the end of the opening day of the Ryder Cup in 21 years.

title: Netanyahu Vows to Continue Hamas War Amid Global Criticism at UN
snippets: The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.
The Israeli leader rails against critics and denounces Western allies for recognising Palestine in fiery UN address.

Israeli prime minister said recognition of Palestinian state is ‘insane’ days after countries such as UK and France did so

  • Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu’s sp

UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Encircled by critics and protesters at the United Nations, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told fellow world leaders on Friday that his nation “must finish the job” against Hamas in Gaza, giving a defiant speech despite growing international isolation over his refusal
titles: At U.N., amid jeers and cheers, Netanyahu says Israel 'must finish the job' in Gaza
As delegates walk out, Netanyahu tells UN Israel must ‘finish job’ in Gaza
Netanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk out
Facing global isolation at UN, a defiant Netanyahu says Israel ‘must finish the job’ against Hamas
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivered a defiant speech at the United Nations, insisting on continuing the war against Hamas despite international isolation and criticism, including from Western allies who have recognized Palestinian statehood. His remarks followed actions by countries like the UK and France in recognizing Palestine, which led to protests and walkouts during his address. Netanyahu's stance has drawn accusations of war crimes and increased pressure to end the conflict, amidst reports of Palestinians living in poverty.

title: Supreme Court Backs Trump, Allows $5bn Foreign Aid Freeze
snippets: The court's majority said Trump's foreign policy authority outweighed the harms claimed by the international aid groups suing.
A lower court had previously ordered Trump to disburse the congressionally approved aid before its expiration date.

Justices rule in favour of administration, handing Trump another victory in dispute over presidential power

The supreme court on Friday extended an order that allows Donald Trump’s administration to keep frozen nearly $5bn in foreign aid, handing him another victory in a dispute over presid
titles: Supreme Court allows Trump to withhold $4 billion in foreign aid
US Supreme Court sides with Trump on freezing $4bn in foreign aid
US supreme court allows Trump to withhold nearly $5bn in foreign aid
summary: The Supreme Court ruled in favor of Donald Trump's administration, allowing it to keep nearly $5bn in foreign aid frozen, marking another victory for Trump in disputes over presidential power. The court decided Trump's foreign policy authority was more significant than the harms claimed by suing international aid groups. This decision overrides a lower court's order to disburse the congressionally approved aid before its expiration.

title: Florida Panthers' Barkov Undergoes Knee Surgery, Could Miss Season
snippets: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov is expected to miss seven to nine months after having surgery to address ACL and MCL injuries to his knee, the team announced Friday.

The Florida Panthers could be without their captain for the entire season.

Barkov out 7-9 months for Panthers following ACL, MCL surgery - NHL.com
Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov has knee surgery, could miss season
summary: Florida Panthers captain Aleksander Barkov underwent knee surgery and may miss the entire regular season. This leaves the team without their leader for potentially the whole season.

title: UN Delegates Walk Out During Netanyahu's Speech, Canada's Rae Stays Seated
snippets: Officials and diplomats left the auditorium in protest as the Israeli leader took the stage, leaving large parts of the hall empty.
Israel's prime minister said it would be "madness" for Israel to allow a Palestinian state to be established. Many delegates left the room before Benjamin Netanyahu began his speech. DW has more.
Netanyahu faces mass walk-out protest at UN speech
A Palestinian state would be “national suicide” for Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, but many of the diplomats and leaders at the assembly boycotted his remarks.
titles: Netanyahu attacks Palestinian recognition as dozens walk out of UN speech
UNGA: Netanyahu rejects Palestinian state in fiery speech
Netanyahu faces mass walk-out protest at UN speech - Axios
Defiant Netanyahu Denounces Palestine Recognition, to a Mostly Empty U.N. Hall
summary: During Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's speech at the UN General Assembly, a significant number of UN delegates walked out in protest. However, Canada's Ambassador Bob Rae did not participate in the walkout and remained seated throughout Netanyahu's address.

Niners Issue Injury Update for Brock Purdy Ahead of Sunday's Game vs. Jaguars - Sports Illustrated
49ers’ Brock Purdy to return as starting QB after toe injury
summary: Mac Jones led the 49ers to two victories while Brock Purdy was sidelined with a toe injury. Purdy is set to return to play for the San Francisco 49ers this week after missing two games.

title: NY Financier Howard Rubin Indicted on Sex Trafficking Charges
snippets: Howard Rubin, an infamous money manager, was sued in 2017 by Playboy models and another woman who claimed they were beaten, sexually abused and raped.
New York financier Howard Rubin and his personal assistant Jennifer Powers were charged with sex trafficking on Friday afternoon, an indictment shows.
Federal prosecutors have formally charged Howard Rubin with crimes connected to an alleged $1 million sex scheme.
titles: Money manager Howard Rubin detained in sex trafficking case after feds cite hitman threat
New York financier Howard Rubin and his personal assistant charged with sex trafficking
Who is Howie Rubin, the money manager charged with sex trafficking and torturing women?
summary: In 2017, Howard Rubin, a New York financier, was sued by Playboy models and another woman for alleged beatings, sexual abuse, and rape. Recently, Rubin and his assistant Jennifer Powers were indicted on sex trafficking charges by federal prosecutors, related to an alleged $1 million sex scheme.

title: Leigh Leopards Beat Wakefield 26-10, Advance to Super League Semi-Final
snippets: Leigh Leopards sweep aside Wakefield 26-10 in the first Super League play-off eliminator to book a semi-final place against Wigan.

• Leigh 26-10 Wakefield

  • First-half blitz sets up showdown for Grand Final spot

Leigh set up a second consecutive semi-final shot at near-neighbours Wigan after brushing aside visitors Wakefield 26-10 in their Super League elimination playoff.

Three tries
Highlights of the Super League match between Leigh Leopards and Wakefield Trinity.
Leigh Leopards put in a 26-10 domination of Wakefield Trinity at the Progress with Unity Stadium to book their spot in the semi-finals of Super League for the second year in a row.
titles: Leigh beat Wakefield to set up Wigan semi-final
Leigh overcome Wakefield in playoff to set up semi-final rematch with Wigan
Leigh sweep aside Wakefield to set up semi-final against Wigan!
Leigh book semi-final spot with dominant win over Wakefield
summary: Leigh Leopards defeated Wakefield Trinity 26-10 in the Super League play-off eliminator, securing a semi-final place against Wigan. The victory, highlighted by a strong first-half performance and three tries, marks Leigh's second consecutive semi-final appearance in the competition.

title: Canadian Postal Workers Strike Over Government's Cost-Cutting Measures
snippets:
Union says it’s ‘outraged and appalled’ by government’s order of sweeping changes to the national service

Postal workers in Canada have gone on strike after the government warned of an “existential crisis” and ordered sweeping changes t
Canada Post is on pace to lose $1 billion this year, officials say. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers says it was blindsided by cost-cutting measures.
The government’s previous attempts at postal service cuts were politically unpopular, but Canada Post’s dire financial situation has expedited them.
titles: Canada postal workers strike after government orders end to door-to-door delivery
Canada Post to end home delivery; workers strike in protest
Canada Orders Postal Service to End Door-to-Door Mail Delivery
summary: Postal workers in Canada have gone on strike following the government's announcement of major changes to the national postal service, citing an "existential crisis." The Canadian Union of Postal Workers expressed shock and outrage at the cost-cutting measures introduced in response to Canada Post's projected $1 billion loss this year. Previous efforts to reduce postal service costs were unpopular, but the current financial challenges have made such measures more urgent.

title: Hackers Threaten to Leak Data of Nursery Children and Staff at Kido Internationa
snippets: The criminals say they will share 30 more profiles along with 100 employees' data if a ransom is not paid.

Criminals calling themselves Radiant say they will post additional private data online unless they are paid

Hackers with pictures and the private information of thousands of nursery children have threatened to publish more information online unless they are paid.

Criminals calling the
Kido International, which runs nursery schools, reported the incident to the authorities after hackers posted sensitive data on the dark web and demanded a ransom.
titles: Nursery hackers threaten to publish more children's profiles online
Kido nursery hackers threaten to publish more children’s profiles
Hackers Steal Children’s Data and Photos from U.K. Nursery Chain
summary: Hackers, identifying as Radiant, have threatened to release private data of thousands of nursery children and 100 employees from Kido International unless a ransom is paid. The group has already posted sensitive information on the dark web. Kido International has reported the incident to the authorities.

title: EA in Talks for $50B Deal, Possibly Largest Buyout Ever
snippets: The deal would likely be the largest leverage buyout of all time, according to a report.
Company behind ‘Madden NFL’ title in talks with investors including Jared Kushner’s Affinity Partners
A transaction reportedly in the works could value Electronic Arts at $50 billion.
titles: Electronic Arts stock closes up 15% on report company near $50 billion deal to go private
Video game maker Electronic Arts nears $50bn deal to go private
Videogame maker Electronic Arts’ stock jumps on news of take-private deal
summary: Electronic Arts, the company known for the 'Madden NFL' video game, is in discussions with investors, including Jared Kushner's Affinity Partners, for a potential transaction. This deal, if completed, could value Electronic Arts at $50 billion, making it possibly the largest leverage buyout in history.

title: Global Health Leaders Disappointed by RFK Jr.'s Stance on NCD Initiative
snippets: Global health leaders expressed dismay at Kennedy's objection but vowed to move forward without the support of the U.S.

General assembly backs new targets on cancer, diabetes and heart disease but Robert F Kennedy Jr objects

A new vision for tackling the global noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) crisis has failed to reach consensus at the UN after the
titles: RFK Jr. 'rejects' a U.N. declaration on non-communicable diseases
US refuses to back UN declaration on noncommunicable diseases
summary: Global health leaders were disappointed by Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s opposition to a UN plan aimed at addressing noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) like cancer, diabetes, and heart disease. Despite his objection, the general assembly supported new targets for tackling these illnesses. The initiative will proceed without unanimous consensus.

title: LSU's Durham Doubtful for Ole Miss Game After Ankle Injury

Durham left last week's win over Southeastern Louisiana with an ankle issue

Caden Durham injury: LSU's top RB (ankle) 'doubtful' for showdown at No. 13 Ole Miss, per report
summary: LSU running back Caden Durham, who suffered an ankle injury in last week's game against Southeastern Louisiana, is doubtful for the upcoming Saturday game against Ole Miss, according to ESPN sources.

title: Hezly Rivera Withdraws from Gymnastics Worlds Due to Ankle Injury
snippets: Hezly Rivera said on Instagram that she will miss the gymnastics world championships after rolling her ankle.

In a significant blow to Team USA, Olympic and U.S. Champion Hezly Rivera has withdrawn from the World Selection Event due to an ankle injury, putting her out of contention for the World Championships.
titles: Paris Olympics gold medalist Hezly Rivera will miss gymnastics world championships
Olympic Champion Hezly Rivera Injured, Withdraws From World Championships Selection
summary: Olympic and U.S. Champion Hezly Rivera announced on Instagram that she will not compete in the gymnastics world championships due to an ankle injury sustained during the World Selection Event. This withdrawal marks a significant loss for Team USA.

title: Braves Claim Pitcher Manoah Off Waivers from Blue Jays
snippets: Manoah was designated for assignment by the Blue Jays to make room on Toronto’s 40-man roster for Anthony Santander to come off the 60-day injured list.
Alek Manoah has a new home. The Atlanta Braves claimed the starter pitcher off waivers from the Toronto Blue Jays, the teams announced on Friday
titles: Braves claim Alek Manoah, transfer Ozzie Albies to 60-day injured list
Braves claim ex-Blue Jay Alek Manoah off waivers
summary: The Atlanta Braves claimed starting pitcher Alek Manoah off waivers from the Toronto Blue Jays. This move was made to free up space on Toronto's 40-man roster, allowing Anthony Santander to be activated from the 60-day injured list.

title: Chiefs' Fastest Receiver Worthy Returns for Ravens Game After Injury
snippets: Xavier Worthy, the Chiefs' fastest receiver, is expected to play in Sunday's game against the Ravens after missing the past two games with a shoulder injury.
The Kansas City Chiefs will get an ejection of energy for a big game in Week 4.
titles: Chiefs WR Worthy set to return Sunday vs. Ravens
Chiefs’ Xavier Worthy expected to play vs. Ravens
summary: Xavier Worthy, the Kansas City Chiefs' fastest receiver, is set to return for Sunday's game against the Ravens after missing two games due to a shoulder injury. His comeback is expected to boost the team's performance in Week 4.

• Spectators and staff experience huge queues

  • Trump is first sitting US president to attend the event

Scores of Ryder Cup fans were denied glimpses of the opening tee shots at Bethpage Black due to stringent security measures put in place before the arrival of
titles: Ryder Cup scores and results
Donald Trump’s Ryder Cup visit results in fans missing early action due to tight security
summary: The 45th Ryder Cup at Bethpage began on 26 September, marked by long queues for spectators and staff due to strict security for the first-ever attendance of a sitting US president, Donald Trump. The event experienced delays, with some fans missing opening shots.

title: Moldova Court Bans Pro-Russia Party from Election Over Alleged Misconduct
snippets: Moldova election rocked by bans on pro-Russian parties as EU path hangs in balance.

The pro-Russia Heart of Moldova party was barred from the election after a court ruling limited the party's activities for one year, over allegations of voter bribery, illegal party financing and money laundering.
titles: Moldova bans pro-Russian parties ahead of Sunday’s election
Moldova bars pro-Russia party from parliamentary elections
summary: Moldova's election faced controversy as the pro-Russia Heart of Moldova party was banned from participating due to a court ruling. The court accused the party of voter bribery, illegal financing, and money laundering, restricting its activities for one year. This development has significant implications for Moldova's political direction and its potential path towards the EU.

Defense secretary Pete Hegseth has announced that 20 US soldiers who took part in the 1890 massacre of hundreds of Lakota men, women and children at Wounded Knee will keep the Medal

summary: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth announced that 20 US soldiers who participated in the 1890 Wounded Knee Massacre, where approximately 250 Lakota Sioux were killed in South Dakota, will retain their Medals of Honor.

title: Electrons Travel Underground, Linking Chemical Zones for Ecosystem Health
snippets: Electrons flow underground in ways far more extensive than once believed, forming networks that link distant chemical zones. Minerals, organic molecules, and specialized bacteria can act as bridges, creating long-distance electron highways. These discoveries hold promise for pollution cleanup strate
Beneath our feet, an invisible world of electron exchanges quietly drives the chemistry that sustains ecosystems, controls water quality, and even determines the fate of pollutants.
titles: Hidden “electron highways” beneath our feet could revolutionize pollution cleanup
Study reveals hidden 'electron highways' that power underground chemistry and pollution cleanup
summary: Researchers have discovered that electrons can travel underground over long distances, connecting separate chemical zones through networks formed by minerals, organic molecules, and bacteria. This process, crucial for ecosystem sustainability, water quality, and pollutant degradation, suggests new methods for environmental cleanup.

The theme for the Middle School Aviation Challenge is "AgAir: Integrating UAS into the Agriculture Industry," highlighting the significance of uncrewed aircraft systems (UAS) in agriculture for food, fuel, and economic development. Participants are encouraged to explore the impact of UAS technology in the agricultural sector.

title: New Studies Shed Light on Bigscale Pomfret and Gaslighting Mechanisms
titles: What Is the Bigscale Pomfret? Scientists Unravel Secrets of an Oceanic Enigma
Scientists Unravel Secrets of How Gaslighting Really Works
summary: Scientists have conducted studies on the Bigscale Pomfret, revealing new insights into this oceanic species. In separate research, experts have also uncovered the mechanisms behind gaslighting, offering a deeper understanding of this psychological manipulation technique. Both studies contribute to our knowledge of marine biology and human behavior, respectively.
